location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'File 9/20 Naval and Shipping: Infringement of Muscat territorial waters by Persian Navy'

physicalDescription.extent: The file is arranged in chronological order, from the front to the rear.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 25, these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: Correspondence concerning the question of Iranian rights to search foreign vessels outside their territorial waters. The papers cover the report of such an incident involving dhows from Dubai and the interdepartmental discussion of what rights the Iranians have and what action should be taken should such a thing occur again. Correspondence comes from officials at the Political Residency in the Persian Gulf, the British Legation in Tehran, the India Office, and the Foreign Office.
